BR_text.BRsummary: ImageRecordIter interpolation method (inter_method) fails for NN (0)
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
 
 Creating a ImageRecordIter with inter_method=0 fails with:
 <denchmark-code>MXNetError: [15:05:24] src/io/image_aug_default.cc:338: Check failed: (param_.inter_method >= 1 && param_.inter_method <= 4) || (param_.inter_method >= 9 && param_.inter_method <= 10) invalid inter_method: valid value 0,1,2,3,9,10
 </denchmark-code>
 
 The check param_.inter_method >= 1 is just wrong, should be >= 0.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment info (Required)</denchmark-h>
 
 Package used (Python/R/Scala/Julia): Python
 <denchmark-h:h2>Error Message:</denchmark-h>
 
 <denchmark-code>MXNetError: [15:05:24] src/io/image_aug_default.cc:338: Check failed: (param_.inter_method >= 1 && param_.inter_method <= 4) || (param_.inter_method >= 9 && param_.inter_method <= 10) invalid inter_method: valid value 0,1,2,3,9,10
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Minimum reproducible example</denchmark-h>
 
 data_iter = mx.io.ImageRecordIter(
         path_imgrec = rec_path,
         path_imgidx = idx_path,
         data_shape = data_shape,
         batch_size = 8,
 
         shuffle = False,
         random_seed = 0,
         seed_aug = 0,
         round_batch = False,
         max_rotate_angle = 10)
 
 batch = data_iter

comments_0.comment_text:
Hey, this is the MXNet Label Bot.

 Here are my recommended labels: Doc

comments_2.comment_text: Your point is right, would you like to submit a fix for it?

comments_3.comment_text: I guess that fixes the problem!
